p: The GC-MS analysis techniques are often employed to identify the components of essential oils [ 28]. The identification of a single compound is based on the retention time and mass spectrometry of the sample. The GC-MS analysis of the SAEO before and after encapsulation is presented in Table 1. It can be seen from the Table 1 that the compositions and relative contents of SAEO after encapsulating changed, which may affect its antibacterial properties. Thirteen of SAEO main components were identified by GC-MS, which represent 97.09% ± 2.35% of all the components in SAEO ( Table 1). The major components were identified as trans-anethole (91.38% ± 0.98%), estragole (2.55% ± 0.41%), and trans-foeniculin (2.15% ± 0.65%). This result is similar to that of Aly et al. [ 14], though the content of the compounds is slightly different.
